com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.attribute

Class Precision

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • com.thinkaurelius.titan.graphdb.database.serialize.attribute.AbstractDecimal
        • com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.attribute.Precision
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<AbstractDecimal>

    public class Precision
extends AbstractDecimal
    Data type for a decimal value that can be used in the definition of a PropertyKey instead of using Double since precision values have a fixed number of decimals places, namely 6, and as such allow for order preserving serialization. In other words, use this data type when only up to 6 decimal places are needed and ordering is important in the definition of vertex centric indices.
    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)
    See Also:
    Decimal, Serialized Form
